title: Electrical charging of snow and ice in polar regions and the potential impact on atmospheric chemistry
content:
Environ. Sci.: Atmos., 2024, 4,144-163
DOI: 10.1039/D3EA00084B, Critical Review
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Kateryna Tkachenko, Hans-Werner Jacobi
Different processes can lead to high electrical field strengths in snow and ice in polar regions with the potential to initiate free radical processes and a number of other chemical modifications.
